2:
They have gone up to the temple, the people of Dibon went up to the heights to weep;\q1 Moab laments over Nebo and over Medeba.
\q1 All their heads are shaved bare and all their beards are cut off.


\q1
3:
In their streets they wear sackcloth; on their housetops\q1 and in the square everyone wails, melting in tears.
\q1
4:
Heshbon and Elealeh call out for help; their sound is heard as far as Jahaz.\q1 So the armed men of Moab call out for help; they tremble within themselves.


\q1
6:
The waters of Nimrim have dried up;\q1 the grass is withered away and the new grass dies; nothing is green.
\q1
7:
The abundance they have grown and stored\q1 they carry away over the brook of the poplars.


\q1
8:
The cry has gone around the territory of Moab;\q1 the wailing as far as Eglaim and Beer Elim.
\q1
9: For the waters of Dimon are full of blood; but I will bring even more upon Dimon.\q1 A lion will attack those who escape from Moab and also those remaining in the land.
